item.title: Pokemon Go October 2025 Events: Raid Bosses, Spotlight Hours, Community Day, And More
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Pokemon Go's Tales of Transformation season continues in October with a variety of different events happening over the next few weeks. In addition to new Spotlight Hours and raid bosses, the game will host a few autumn-themed activities this month like the Harvest Festival, which will introduce two new evolved forms of Applin.

On top of that, there's also Mega Rayquaza Raid Day to look forward to, as well as an event to celebrate the launch of the Pokemon series' latest title, Pokemon Legends: Z-A. And of course, October wouldn't be complete without the annual Halloween event, which will be split up into two parts this year and add a few new ghost and costumed Pokemon to catch.

You can read more about all of the biggest events happening in Pokemon Go for October 2025 below.

October Raid Schedule

Pokemon Go is refreshing its raid rotation once again with a new selection of legendary and Mega Pokemon to challenge this month.

Multiple forms of Deoxys and Genesect are returning to five-star raids over the next few weeks, while a slew of Mega-Evolved Pokemon will make an encore appearance in Mega raids. You can also encounter some seasonal Dynamax Pokemon in Max Battles throughout the month, including Gastly and Woobat.

You can see October's full raid schedule below:

October Spotlight Hours

Pokemon Go's weekly Spotlight Hour events continue in October with a new selection of Pokemon and bonuses.

Every Tuesday evening from 6-7 PM local time, one particular species of Pokemon will appear more frequently in the wild. On top of that, you'll earn an extra bonus for participating in the event, such as double Stardust or XP when you catch Pokemon.

You can see October's full Spotlight Hour schedule below:

October 7

  • Featured Pokemon: Ferroseed
  • Bonus: 2x evolution XP

October 14

  • Featured Pokemon: Petilil
  • Bonus: 2x catch Stardust

October 21

  • Featured Pokemon: Gastly
  • Bonus: 2x catch XP

October 28

  • Featured Pokemon: Sinistea
  • Bonus: 2x catch candy

Steel Skyline

Pokemon Go is kicking off October with the Steel Skyline event, which runs until October 7.

As its name suggests, steel-type and other city-dwelling Pokemon like Alolan Diglett, Galarian Meowth, Skarmory, Trubbish, and Klink will appear in the wild more frequently throughout the event. You'll also have a chance to encounter Dynamax Duraludon; the steel/dragon Pokemon will appear in four-star Max Battles.

On top of the featured Pokemon, various Global Challenges will be active during the event, with different rewards unlocking as players collectively complete these missions. There will also be free event-themed Field and Timed Research tasks, as well as a paid Timed Research ticket that offers additional challenges and rewards.

Featured Pokemon

  • Alolan Diglett
  • Magnemite

  • Alolan Grimer

Mega Metagross is making its long-awaited Pokemon Go debut as part of a Mega Raid Day event on October 4.

The Mega-Evolved Pokemon will appear in gyms as a Mega raid boss from 2-5 PM local time. Each Metagross you face will know the ghost-type Fast Attack Shadow Claw, and you'll have an increased chance of encountering a shiny one if you successfully clear the raid.

A few bonuses will also be active during the event. As usual, the number of Remote Raid Passes you can hold will be temporarily increased to 20, letting you participate in more battles remotely. On top of that, you can receive up to five extra free Raid Passes when you spin the Photo Disc at gyms.

Bonuses

  • Remote Raid Pass limit increased to 20 (from October 3-4)
  • Receive up to five additional free Raid Passes when you spin the Photo Disc at gyms
  • Increased odds of encounter shiny Metagross in Mega Raids

Harvest Festival

Pokemon Go is celebrating the arrival of fall with a Harvest Festival event from October 10-16.

As part of the festivities, two new Pokemon are making their debut in the game: Dipplin and Hydrapple. You'll also be able to collect a new type of item: Syrupy Apples. These may appear at PokeStops that are equipped with an active Mossy Lure Module.

Other autumny Pokemon like Miltank, Combee, and Smoliv will also appear more frequently during the event, and a few bonuses will be active. You'll earn double candy when you catch a Pokemon with Pinap or Silver Pinap Berries, and you'll have increased odds of encountering shiny versions of Pumpkaboo and Smoliv.

Bonuses

  • 2x candy for catching Pokemon with Pinap and Silver Pinap Berries
  • Increased chance to encounter shiny Pumpkaboo and shiny Smoliv
  • Increased chance for apples to appear at PokeStops with an active Mossy Lure Module

October's Community Day takes place on October 12, and the featured Pokemon this time is the psychic type Solosis.

From 2-5 PM local time, Solosis will appear in the wild more frequently than usual, making this a good chance to catch some and stock up on Solosis candy. Thanks to the increased spawn rate, you'll have better odds of encountering a shiny Solosis as well.

As the featured Pokemon, Solosis is also able to learn an event-exclusive attack. If you can evolve one into Reuniclus by 9 PM local time, the Pokemon will automatically learn the fairy-type Fast Attack Charm upon evolving.

Rounding out the event are a few other in-game bonuses. You'll earn triple Stardust and double candy for catching Pokemon, while players who are level 31 and above will be twice as likely to also earn Candy XL. On top of that, any Incense that you activate will last for three hours, while Lure Modules will last for one.

Bonuses

  • 3x Stardust for catching Pokemon
  • 2x candy for catching Pokemon
  • 2x chance to receive Candy XL from catching Pokemon (for players level 31 and above)
  • Incense will last for three hours (excluding Daily Adventure Incense)
  • Lure Modules will last for one hour
  • One additional Special Trade can be made
  • Trades will require 50 percent less Stardust

Pokemon Go is celebrating the launch of Pokemon Legends: Z-A with a special crossover event from October 16-20.

Throughout the event, Mega raids will occur at gyms more frequently than usual, giving you more chances to fill out your Pokedex and earn Mega Energy. On top of that, there will be free Timed Research tasks. Completing these will net you various rewards, including opportunities to catch the three starter Pokemon from Z-A: Chikorita, Tepig, and Totodile. Finally, the Style Shop will add new Z-A-inspired outfits for your avatar.

Bonuses

  • Mega raids will appear more frequently

Mega Raid Day

Mega Rayquaza is swooping in for a special Mega Raid Day event on October 18.

From 2-5 PM local time, Mega Rayquaza will appear in gyms as a Mega raid boss. If you're able to successfully clear the raid, you'll have increased odds of encountering a shiny Rayquaza afterward.

On top of that, there will also be free Timed Research tasks to complete during the event. These will reward you with a Meteorite, which is required to teach Rayquaza the Charged Attack Dragon Ascent.

Bonuses

  • Remote Raid Pass limit increased to 20 (from October 17-18)
  • Receive up to five additional free Raid Passes when you spin the Photo Disc at gyms
  • Increased chance of encounter shiny Rayquaza from Mega raids

Halloween 2025 Part I

Pokemon Go is closing out the month with its annual Halloween event. Like previous years, the festivities will be broken up into two parts, the first of which runs October 21-27.

Two new ghost Pokemon are making their debut during the event: Poltchageist and its evolved form, Sinistcha. On top of that, shiny Sinistea will be appearing for the first time in Pokemon Go.

Along with the new Pokemon, plenty of ghost and dark Pokemon like Greavard, Zorua, and Hisuian Zorua will appear in the wild and in raid battles more frequently. You'll also have a chance to encounter themed Pokemon as you complete Field Research tasks during the event.

Go Battle Weekend

Pokemon Go is capping off the first part of this year's Halloween event with a Go Battle Weekend on October 25-26.

Halloween 2025 Part II

The second leg of Pokemon Go's Halloween 2025 celebration runs October 27-November 2.

During this portion of the event, various costume-wearing Pokemon will appear in the wild and as raid bosses. In addition to costumed Pokemon from previous years, you'll also have a chance to encounter some new spooky Pokemon, like Teddiursa wearing a witch hat and Noibat wearing a headband.

On top of that, there will be more event-themed Field Research tasks to complete. Clear these and you'll earn different rewards, including additional encounters with the featured Pokemon and Mega Energy for Houndoom, Gengar, Sableye, and other monsters.

A few bonuses will also be available. Not only will you have increased odds of encountering shiny costumed Pokemon through raids during the entire event, but you'll also be able to earn some extra candy on October 31. Costumed Pokemon that you catch with a Nice Throw or better on Halloween will have a chance to give Rare Candy or Rare Candy XL.

item.title: Rockstar Accused Of Firing Grand Theft Auto Devs Over Union Organization
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Grand Theft Auto 6 is just over six months away, but there's something brewing at the game's developer, Rockstar Games. The studio fired between 30 and 40 staff members from offices in the United Kingdom and Canada earlier this week. The terminated employees were reportedly attempting to unionize when they were let go.

Bloomberg broke the story, and added that all of the fired employees were part of a private trade union chat group on Discord. According to a spokesperson for the Independent Workers' Union of Great Britain, the group was a mix of members who had already joined the union and others who were trying to organize a union at Rockstar.

"Rockstar has just carried out one of the most blatant and ruthless acts of union busting in the history of the games industry," said IWGB president Alex Marshall in a statement. "This flagrant contempt for the law and for the lives of the workers who bring in their billions is an insult to their fans and the global industry."

A spokesperson from Rockstar's parent company, Take-Two Interactive, said that it supported Rockstar's decision and alleged that the employees were terminated "for gross misconduct, and for no other reason."

This seems like the kind of dispute that may ultimately be settled inside of a courtroom, depending on what the British and Canadian courts have to say about it. This may take a long time for this to play out.

Rockstar Games recently shared a job listing which predicted that GTA 6 will have the biggest launch in video game history. That seems very likely considering that Grand Theft Auto 5 passed 215 million in sales earlier this year, and GTA Online continues to be a cash cow for the company.

Take-Two CEO Strauss Zelnick also noted that he isn't worried about AI competing with GTA, and he's been pretty consistent in his assessment of the technology.

GTA 6 will hit PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X|S on May 26, 2026.

item.title: Get 13 PC Games For $13 With the Indie Fears Humble Bundle
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Today is Halloween, and what better way to celebrate than with a handful of spooky games. Humble Bundle is offering 13 games for $13 ($114 value) with their Indie Fears Bundle. $13 gets you all the games on offer, but as always with Humble Bundle you can choose to pay more. If you do, portions of the proceeds get donated to charity. The Indie Fears Bundle benefits SpecialEffect, a UK-based charity whose goal is bringing video games to all disabled gamers around the world. This bundle is available until November 21, so you have plenty of time to pick it up.

One of the most notable inclusions here is Mouthwashing, which took the indie horror game community by storm when it came out last year. It sports a retro PS1-era graphical style and sees you play as a crew member of the space freighter Tulpar, delving into its mysterious crash landing by exploring the ship, chatting with your crewmates, and solving puzzles. It's more of a narrative-focused walking sim than a survival horror game with combat, but it's still a tense, scary game perfect for the season.

Then there's Arctic Eggs, which also features a purposefully downgraded graphical style (countless indie horror games do this, and I love it). In it, as the name implies, your goal is to fry eggs and cook breakfast for folks in a near-future dystopian Antarctica. The frying mechanics aren't the easiest to master, and you'll often have to fry weird items like bullets and cigarettes for the denizens. It's a relatively short game, but the story and setting and just weird and interesting enough to stay engaged.

Also available is Terror at Oakheart, a love-letter to 80's and 90's slasher films complete with a rip-off of the nursery rhyme from A Nightmare On Elm Street in the trailer. This is a 2D sidescrolling game with a visual style that would feel right at home on the Game Boy Advance. It's an action-adventure game with a nonlinear story that sees you taking control of both the killer and the victims, a unique take on the genre.

One such collection is the Bandai Namco Dark Pictures & Little Nightmares bundle, which contains the first two Little Nightmares games and the entire Dark Pictures Anthology, including Man of Medan, Little Hope, House of Ashes, and The Devil in Me. Get all seven games for a minimum of $15.

There's also the Horror Icons Showcase, which gets you up to nine games for $20. The titles on offer include the Bendy trilogy, Morruary Assistant Definitive Edition, Choo-Choo Charles, Scorn, Axis Unseen, and more.

If you're a fan of dystopian narrative-focused games, the Cosmic Mysteries & Noir Realities bundle is for you. Headlining this collection is Disco Elysium: The Final Cut, but you can also get other story-rich titles like Genesis Noir, Norco, Tales of the Neon Sea, and more all for just $10.

item.title: Xbox Elite Series 2 Controller On Sale For Lowest Price This Year
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Microsoft's Elite Series 2 Wireless Controller is discounted to $140 (was $200) at Amazon and Walmart. The $60 price cut is the best we've seen in 2025. If Amazon and Walmart sell out--and we wouldn't be surprised if that happened--the Elite Series 2 is available for $145 at Target and $150 at Best Buy.

The Elite Series 2 has numerous customizable features and swappable magnetic components not found on the standard Xbox Wireless Controller. Here's a quick look at the controller's key extra features and accessories:

  • Four removable back paddles
  • Metal analog sticks with adjustable tension
  • Six swappable stick caps
    • standard (x2), classic (x2), wide dome, tall
  • Two D-pads: Circular 8-way & standard 4-way
  • Built-in trigger locks with three stopping points
  • Three custom control profiles
  • Charging dock
  • Braided USB-C cable
  • Hardshell case with accessory slots

Standard Xbox Wireless Controllers are also steeply discounted at multiple major retailers. Carbon Black and Robot White editions are on sale for only $40, and the recently released Breaker Special Editions are down to $60 (was $80). We included a full list of deals at the bottom of this story.

Xbox Elite Series 2 Controller

$140 (was $200)

The four back paddles are located where your fingers are likely to rest naturally. Some players use all four at the same time, while others only connect one on each side. Since they are removable, you have that choice.

The paddles are the main draw for a lot of players, but the Elite Series 2 also has customizable sticks and directional pads. It comes with six swappable stick caps for the higher-quality metal analog sticks. You can adjust the tension on both sticks with the included tool. It's worth noting these are not Hall Effect sticks, so just like with the Xbox Wireless Controller, stick drift is a possibility. I've never had any issues with my Elite Series 2, but it can happen.

The Elite Series 2 has a unique, circular 8-way D-pad designed for quick movements. It can take some time to get used to it, but you can swap it out for a conventional 4-way D-pad. In addition to the swappable components, the Elite Series 2 has switches on the back to lock the triggers (RT and LT) to three different stopping points.

You can create three different control profiles using the Xbox Accessories App. Control layouts save to the controller and can be cycled through on the fly. Along with remapping the paddles and other controls, you can adjust stick sensitivity, vibration intensity, and more.

Unlike the Xbox Wireless Controller, the Elite Series 2 has a rechargeable battery and can run for up to 40 hours. You can charge it via USB-C or by placing it on the magnetic charging dock. The braided USB-C cable is roughly nine-feet long and can be stored in the carrying case's mesh compartment.

The Elite Series 2 released in 2019, but it's still the best premium controller for Xbox and PC. I've tested dozens of these types of controllers for all major platforms, and I have yet to find one that matches the Elite Series 2 in the ergonomics and overall feel departments. It's one of the rare controllers where the difference is immediately noticeable due to excellent weight distribution, textured grips, and sturdier shell.

The Elite Series 2 previously retailed for $180, but it received a $20 bump in May when Microsoft raised the price of Xbox hardware and first-party accessories in response to the US tariff situation. Standard and Special Edition Xbox Wireless Controllers received $5 price increases at the same time.

You can save up to $25 on Xbox Wireless Controllers at Amazon, Walmart, and Best Buy.
